column1: Vanves French pronunciation: ​[vɑ̃v] is a commune in the southwestern suburbs of Paris
column2: France. It is located 5.6 km (3.5 mi) from the center of Paris. It is one of the most densely populated municipalities in Europe and the tenth in France
the city of Paris was enlarged by annexing neighboring communes. On that occasion
column3: about a third of the commune of Vanves was annexed to Paris
column4: and forms now essentially the neighborhood of Plaisance

column2: about half of the territory of Vanves was detached and became the commune of Malakoff.

column1: Vanves is served by Malakoff – Plateau de Vanves station on Paris Métro Line 13. This station is located at the border between the commune of Vanves and the commune of Malakoff
column2: on the Malakoff side of the border.

column1: Vanves is also served by Vanves – Malakoff station on the Transilien Paris – Montparnasse suburban rail line.
